title: How Rush Limbaugh ‘Spawned’ Glenn Beck | Guest: Christopher Rufo | 2/18/21
description:
Glenn dedicates the show to legendary conservative broadcaster Rush Limbaugh, who passed away Wednesday after his battle with cancer. Glenn tells less well-known stories of Rush and how he created the modern talk show industry and saved AM radio. While the mainstream media and the Left dance on Rush’s grave, Glenn remembers who Rush really was and further shares how he literally owes his career to Rush. Who would be on the “Mount Rushmore of Radio”? Christopher Rufo, director of the Discovery Institute’s Center on Wealth & Poverty, joins to share Rush’s impact on his life and the latest on how fast critical race theory is spreading into schools and workplaces near you.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices
